titles.title: To increase the amount authorized to be appropriated to the Department of the Interior for the Tensas River National Wildlife Refuge.
An Act to increase the amount authorized to be appropriated to the Department of the Interior for Tensas River National Wildlife Refuge, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries, Wildlife and Oceans.
Subcommittee Hearings Held.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 104-526.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 256.

action.text: Mr. Jones moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Committee consideration and Mark Up Session held.

committee.name: Committee on Environment and Public Works

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Environment and Public Works

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Chafee without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 460.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate.
Amendment SP 5400 proposed by Senator Frist for Senator Johnston.
Amendment SP 5400 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment and an amendment to the Title by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Saxton moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendments.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendments Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/24/1996--Passed Senate amended. Increases the authorization of appropriations to the Department of the Interior for the Tensas River National Wildlife Refuge in Louisiana beginning October 1, 1995. Amends the Emergency Wetlands Resources Act of 1986 to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to acquire specified property, including property that contains the Big Oak Island archeological site, to be added to the Bayou Sauvage Urban National Wildlife Refuge.
